snippet: A Swedish diplomat visited Kenneth Bae, who has been imprisoned in North Korea for more than a year, his family reported, as speculation grew over potential talks to free him.
abstract: Kenneth Bae, Korean-American missionary incarcerated in North Korea, is visited by a Swedish diplomat as speculation grows that the State Dept may send an emissary to try to negotiate Bae's release.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and CHOE SANG-HUN
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Choe Sang-Hun from Seoul, South Korea. Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: A Swedish diplomat visited Kenneth Bae, who has been imprisoned in North Korea for more than a year, his family reported, as speculation grew over potential talks to free him.

headline.main: U.S. Prisoner in North Korea Gets Consular Visit
headline.print_headline: North Korea: U.S. Detainee Sent Back to Prison From Hospital, Family Says
